wikipedia.title: Dragostea Din Tei
wikipedia.extract:
"Dragostea Din Tei" (pronounced [ˈdraɡoste̯a din ˈtej] (listen); Romanian for '"Love from the Lindens"'; official English title: "Words of Love"), also informally known as "Ma Ya Hi" and "The Numa Numa Song" (see § Lyrics), is the most successful single by the Moldovan pop group O-Zone. It received positive reviews from critics and shot to the number one spot on the Eurochart Hot 100, where it remained for 12 weeks between June and early September 2004. It topped the single charts in France, Germany and Austria for over three months, reached three in the United Kingdom and 72 on the US Pop 100. The song became the fourth-best-selling single of the 21st century in France, with 1,170,000 units sold.
The original song was made notable in the United States via the viral video "Numa Numa" in which vlogger Gary Brolsma dances to the song. Another remix, entitled "Numa Numa 2," with Brolsma, Dan Balan and Marley Waters, was posted on YouTube on September 12, 2018.
